ai.summary: The Burlescombe Trail is a 14.2 km moderate hike in the UK, following rural lanes and field paths for a steady day on the trail. It suits walkers with intermediate fitness and offers countryside views along the way.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly rural footpaths and minor roads with occasional gates and stiles. Expect a mix of grassy tracks, compacted earth, and gravel; sections can be muddy after rain. Gentle elevation changes with some gradual slopes.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for 4â€“5 hours. Check weather and daylight; wear sturdy hiking boots and weather-appropriate clothing. Carry water and snacks, a map and compass or offline GPS, and a charged phone. Stay on public rights of way, close gates behind you, watch for livestock, and be prepared for reduced mobile signal in remote areas.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or offline GPS
Phone with emergency battery or power bank
ai.best_seasons: Spring to early autumn are ideal; winter hikes are possible with proper gear and caution due to mud and shorter daylight.

seo.title: Burlescombe Trail - 14.2 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Burlescombe Trail, a 14.2 km moderate hike in the UK. Enjoy rural paths, gentle hills, and countryside scenery suitable for hikers with intermediate fitness.
seo.h1: Burlescombe Trail: 14.2 km Moderate UK Walk
